
1. Initialization: At the first iteration, `q` is zero and `arr[q]` is initialized as the first element of the array, so `max_value_copy = arr[q]` is true.
2. Loop invariant maintained: At each iteration, if `arr[q] > max_value`, then `max_value` is updated with `arr[q]` and `max_value_copy = arr[q]`. Therefore, the invariant holds true.
3. Conclusion: After looping through all elements of the array, `max_value` will hold the maximum value of the array and `max_value_copy` will hold the value of the current element after the maximum value was updated. Therefore, the program is partially correct.
